t: Psalm 25
A Plea for Deliverance and Forgiveness
A Psalm of David.
To*pn You, O Lord,*s I lift up my soul.
O*ld my God, I trust in You; Let*ld me not be ashamed; Let*ld not my enemies triumph over me.
Indeed,*ld let no one who waits on You be ashamed; Let*ld those be ashamed who deal treacherously without cause.
Show*ln me Your ways, O Lord;*s Teach*ld me Your paths.
Lead*ld me in Your truth and teach me, For*ld You are*i the God of my salvation; On*ld You I wait all the day.
Remember,*ln O Lord,*s Your tender mercies and Your lovingkindnesses, For*ld they are*i from of old.
Do*ld not remember the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions; According*ld to Your mercy remember me, For*ld Your goodness’ sake, O Lord.*s
Good*ln and upright is*i the Lord;*s Therefore*ld He teaches sinners in the way.
The*ld humble He guides in justice, And*ld the humble He teaches His way.
All*ld the paths of the Lord*s are*i mercy and truth, To*ld such as keep His covenant and His testimonies.
For*ld Your name’s sake, O Lord,*s Pardon*ld my iniquity, for it is*i great.
Who*ln is*i the man that fears the Lord?*s Him*ld shall He teach in the way He chooses.
He*ld himself shall dwell in prosperity, And*ld his descendants shall inherit the earth.
The*ld secret of the Lord*s is*i with those who fear Him, And*ld He will show them His covenant.
My*ld eyes are*i ever toward the Lord,*s For*ld He shall pluck my feet out of the net.
Turn*ln Yourself to me, and have mercy on me, For*ld I am*i desolate and afflicted.
The*ld troubles of my heart have enlarged; Bring*ld me out of my distresses!
Look*ld on my affliction and my pain, And*ld forgive all my sins.
Consider*ld my enemies, for they are many; And*ld they hate me with cruel hatred.
Keep*ld my soul, and deliver me; Let*ld me not be ashamed, for I put my trust in You.
Let*ld integrity and uprightness preserve me, For*ld I wait for You.
Redeem*ln Israel, O God, Out*ld of all their troubles!
